short_summary: Requirement for canine (K9) kennel inserts and optional units
description: The RCMP requires seven (7) canine (K9) kennel inserts, with the option of purchasing up to six (6) canine (K9) kennels, per year, (total of 18 optional units) at any time during the contract period.",
full_summary:
### Tender Notice: Supply of Canine (K9) Kennel Inserts for Suburban Vehicles

#### Overview

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites proposals for the supply of canine (K9) kennel inserts for Suburban vehicles. The contract term is expected to begin on September 15, 2023, and conclude on November 15, 2026.

#### Background

The RCMP requires seven (7) canine (K9) kennel inserts, with the option to purchase up to six (6) additional units per year, totaling 18 optional units. Deliverables must be received on or before November 15, 2023.

#### Basis of Selection

Bidders must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award.

#### Tender Requirements

*   Bid submission deadline: September 5, 2023, at 5 p.m. Eastern Time.
*   Bid submission method: Bidders must submit their proposals electronically to E_Pacific_Bids@rcmp-grc.gc.ca, referencing solicitation number M2989-2-0148/B.
*   Tender documents: Available for download on the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website.

#### Procurement Method

This procurement is conducted as a competitive, open bidding process. The Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada applies to this procurement.

#### Eligibility

Canada recognizes and supports Indigenous procurement. Bidders are encouraged to review the federal Indigenous Business Directory and register for a profile if eligible.

#### Contact Information

For inquiries or further information, please contact Amy Wang at amy.wang@rcmp-grc.gc.ca or 236-330-3559.

#### Notice of Tender Opportunity

Canada makes available tender notices and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/.
